review: Used to have Roku 3s and got myself an Amazon Fire TV when it came out, primarily because of the improved hardware.  After several months,  I'm happy to be rid of the Fire TV and back on the Roku.  I always hated the Fire TV's interface - there are dozens and dozens of tiles on the home page with no way to customize it, all of them directed at having you buy more content from Amazon - all I want is the 4 Icons I use the most.  Some might argue I could just use the voice search function which FireTV has and Roku does not - but I can click faster than that if the icons are in the place I want them, since I need to be holding the remote anyway.  The final nail in the coffin for me was MLS Live app which came out for Roku but not for Fire TV - when it comes down to it, the channel selection for Roku is superior, the Fire TV's superior hardware is not necessary to effectively stream 1080P, and that is all that matters.
